body.p: To his Excellency Charles S. Morehead Govenor of Ky

The undersigned, Petitioners ^citizens of Hancock Co^ respectfully Represent that at the last term of the Henderson Circuit Court a Judgment was rendered according Execution against Abraham Callendra & Mildred Pullin for $600 as securities in a Bail Bond entered into by them for the appearance of Lewis L Pullin in said court to answer an indictment for Counterfeiting -- they say that the said Pullian was a near relative of the said Collander & Midred Pullian who resides in Hancock Co Ky -- that they were drunk influenced by considerations of kind Peition to as his surety -- that they confidently expected him to appear and answer the indictment -- that they had no instrumentality in preventing his appearance, the said Collander is a Black Smith by trade & occupation has a family and is ^in^ very modest circumstances so much so as that the payment of one half the Bond would exhaust his estate the said Mildred Pullin is a widow in ^humble^ moderate circumstances having nothing no property except a Lot in Lewisport on which she resides which would not be more than sufficient to pay one half
the said Execution -- that she is about Years of age -- that the only son on whom She relied for a support lost his life in the Burning of the steam Boat RainBow ^last fall^so that She has now no reliance for a support except the home she has in Lewisport before referred to and the aid of the said Collander Callander her son in law maybe able to --
Wherefore they pray that your excellency will remit said forfeiture

Tho. S. Lowe
